qas.question: Where does formal education take place?
What are some of the sets or ideals most school systems follow?

answers.text: student-teacher interactions, methods of assessment, class size,

qas.question: Who guides the students in a formal environment?
Where does informal education take place?
What is the implicit purpose of a structured environment?
What system is not designed around values and ideals?
What doesn't guide students in formal environments?
Who guides the students in an informal environment?

context: Formal education occurs in a structured environment whose explicit purpose is <b4_0>teaching students<b4_0/>. Usually, formal education takes place in a <a0_0><b3_0>school environment<b3_0/><a0_0/> with classrooms of multiple students learning together with a trained, <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>certified teacher<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> of the subject. Most <b5_0>school<b5_0/> systems are designed around a set of values or ideals that govern all educational choices in that system. Such choices include curriculum, organizational models, design of the physical learning spaces (e.g. classrooms), <a1_0>student-teacher interactions, methods of assessment, class size,<a1_0/> educational activities, and more.
